meanings.definition: A statue that is much bigger than life size.
meanings.sent1: The colossus of a lion at the zoo was so big that it scared the children.
meanings.sent2: The ancient city was known for its impressive colossus of a king standing tall in the square.
meanings.sent3: The colossus of a chef on TV could cook enough food to feed an entire village!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a colossus, towering over all other virtues in her character.
meanings.sent5: The colossus of a tree in the forest cast a shadow that stretched for miles.

meanings.definition: A person or thing of enormous size or importance.
meanings.sent1: The billionaire was a financial colossus, controlling many companies around the world.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the dragon was a terrifying colossus that could destroy entire villages.
meanings.sent3: The colossus of a cake at the party was so huge that everyone wanted a slice!
meanings.sent4: His influence in the community was a colossus, shaping the opinions of many.
meanings.sent5: The mountain stood like a colossus, dominating the landscape with its massive presence.
